description: Before the death of Alexei Navalny, other prominent opposition figures have died after criticizing Russian President Vladimir Putin. Here are their stories.
title: Putin’s dead critics: A journalist, a tax adviser, a politician

description: The Russsian president’s forces are advancing in Ukraine, his main political nemesis is dead, U.S. aid to Kyiv is stalled and fear has squelched protests in Moscow
title: Vladimir Putin, riding high before Navalny’s death, seems unstoppable

description: Tucker Carlson faced a fresh wave of criticism over his controversial interview with Russian President Vladimir Putin, the death of Alexei Navalny on Friday.
title: Tucker Carlson faces new backlash over Putin interview after Navalny death

description: The Ukrainian president seemed to be speaking directly to Americans blocking aid in Congress as he warned that his country, if left alone, would be destroyed by Russia
title: In Munich, Zelensky urges U.S. and other allies not to abandon Ukraine

description: A Catholic priest, an evangelical pastor and the battle for souls in the deepest Amazon.
title: The judgment of São Miguel

description: Alexei Navalny’s spokeswoman confirmed that the Russian opposition leader died in prison, accused Russia of murdering him, and insisted his body be returned by investigators.
title: Navalny team confirms death and demands authorities return body to family

description: The International Court of Justice acknowledged the threat to Rafah but declined South Africa’s request for extra safeguards ahead of Israel’s planned offensive.
title: ICJ declines new protections for Rafah despite ‘perilous situation’ in city

description: The development marks the most significant battlefield victory for Russia since the failure of Ukraine’s counteroffensive last year.
title: Ukraine withdraws from Avdiivka as Russia advances on strategic city
